title: England Test captain Joe Root reacts to Chris Silverwood replacing Trevor Bayliss as coach
text:
Joe Root has backed Chris Silverwood’s appointment as England head coach (Picture: Getty)

Test captain Joe Root has backed the appointment of Chris Silverwood as England’s new head coach.

Former Yorkshire, Middlesex and England bowler Silverwood has taken over from Trevor Bayliss, who stepped down following this summer’s Ashes series.

Silverwood, 44, led Essex to back-to-back titles in the County Championship and has worked with the England men’s team as bowling coach for the best part of two years.

‘I’m delighted for him,’ Root said. ‘He’s done some excellent work since he’s been involved in the team, and I’m sure you’ll have heard all the reports on him.

Silverwood led Essex to back-to-back titles (Picture: Getty)

‘He’s very thorough, very well organised, knows exactly how he wants to take the team forward and has got a very good relationship with the guys.

‘I think that carries a lot of weight and goes a long way. He’s very knowledgable as well, not just about his bowlers and how to take 20 wickets, but about cricket in general.

‘He’s got a very good record in the County Championship with Essex in the two years he was there, both times winning (Division Two and then One).

‘I think it’s a really good appointment.’

The former England bowler takes over from Trevor Bayliss (Picture: Getty)

Former England captain Nasser Hussain has also backed Ashley Giles’ decision to appoint Silverwood as Bayliss’ successor.

‘I think it’s a good appointment. He’s a very solid character and wherever he has been as a coach, he has been successful,’ he said.

‘He went over to Essex when they were in Division Two, took them into Division One and then immediately won the County Championship with them – a side that had been under-performing. He showed his pedigree there.

‘He has since moved on to England, and look at the work he has done with the England bowlers – look at someone like Stuart Broad, for example, and the renaissance he’s had.

Our new Men's Head Coach Chris Silverwood is taking fan questions on the @englandcricket Instagram story. Head over to Instagram and get involved! pic.twitter.com/tpAqAbNLeK — England Cricket (@englandcricket) October 10, 2019

‘He’s someone who seems to ask the right questions, at the right time.

‘He’s that type of coach – he’s not an in-your-face type; he’s very popular in the England dressing room, already in there with the players.’

Silverwood’s first task will be a white and red-ball tour to New Zealand, who England beat in the dramatic World Cup final in July.

Root’s side then travel to South Africa, who are currently 1-0 down in a three-Test series against India.
